org.jerkar.api.java

Class JkJavaCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.java.JkJavaCompiler

  • public final class JkJavaCompiler
extends java.lang.Object
    Stand for a compilation setting and process. Use this class to perform java compilation.

    • Method Detail

      • outputtingIn

        public static JkJavaCompiler outputtingIn(java.io.File outputDir)
        Creates a JkJavaCompiler producing its output in the given directory.

      • base

        public static JkJavaCompiler base()
        Returns a base compiler to set some behavior and parameters on.

      • failOnError

        public JkJavaCompiler failOnError(boolean fail)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified failed on error parameter. If fail is true then a compilation error will throw a IllegalStateException.

      • andOptions

        public JkJavaCompiler andOptions(java.lang.String... options)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but adding the specified options. Options are option you pass in javac command line as -deprecation, -nowarn, ... For example, if you want something equivalent to javac -deprecation -cp path1 path2, you should pass "-deprecation", "-cp", "path1", "path2" parameters (all space separated words must stands for one parameter, in other words : parameters must not contain any space).

      • withOptions

        public JkJavaCompiler withOptions(java.lang.String... options)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified options.
        See Also:
        andOptions(String...)

      • withOutputDir

        public JkJavaCompiler withOutputDir(java.io.File outputDir)
        Creates a copy of this compiler but outputting in the specified directory.

      • withOptionsIf

        public JkJavaCompiler withOptionsIf(boolean condition,
                                    java.lang.String... options)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified options under condition.
        See Also:
        andOptions(String...)

      • withClasspath

        public JkJavaCompiler withClasspath(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> files)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified classpath.

      • withSourceVersion

        public JkJavaCompiler withSourceVersion(java.lang.String version)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified source version.

      • withAnnotationProcessors

        public JkJavaCompiler withAnnotationProcessors(java.lang.String... annotationProcessorClassNames)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but using the specified annotation classes instead of using the ones discovered by default Java 6 mechanism.

      • withEncoding

        public JkJavaCompiler withEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but using the specified source encoding (e.g. UTF-8). If null is specified, then default plateform encoding will be used.

      • withoutAnnotationProcessing

        public JkJavaCompiler withoutAnnotationProcessing()
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but without annotation processing.

      • withAnnotationProcessingOnly

        public JkJavaCompiler withAnnotationProcessingOnly()
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but only for annotation processing (no compilation).

      • withTargetVersion

        public JkJavaCompiler withTargetVersion(java.lang.String version)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the target version.

      • fork

        public JkJavaCompiler fork(java.lang.String... parameters)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with forking the javac process. The javac process is created using specified argument defined in JkProcess.ofJavaTool(String, String...)

      • fork

        public JkJavaCompiler fork(boolean fork,
                           java.lang.String... parameters)
        As fork(String...) but the fork is actually done only if the fork parameter is true.

      • forkOnCompiler

        public JkJavaCompiler forkOnCompiler(java.lang.String executable,
                                     java.lang.String... parameters)
        As fork(String...) but specifying the executable for the compiler.
        Parameters:
        executable - The executable for the compiler as 'jike' or '/my/special/jdk/javac'

      • andSources

        public JkJavaCompiler andSources(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> files)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but adding specified source files.

      • andSourceDir

        public JkJavaCompiler andSourceDir(java.io.File dir)
        See Also:
        andSources(Iterable)

      • withCompiler

        public JkJavaCompiler withCompiler(javax.tools.JavaCompiler compiler)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified compiler instance. Since in-process compilers cannot be run in a forked process, this method disables any previous fork options that may have been set.

      • compile

        public boolean compile()
        Actually compile the source files to the output directory.
        Returns:
        false if a compilation error occurred.
        Throws:
        if - a compilation error occured and the 'failOnError' flag in on.

      • forkedIfNeeded

        public JkJavaCompiler forkedIfNeeded(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> jdkLocations)
        Returns a JkJavaCompiler identical to this one but within a forked process with relevant JDK if this specified source version does not match with the current running JDK. The specified map may include the JDK location for this source version. The keys must be formated as "jdk.[source version]". For example, "jdk.1.4" or "jdk.7". The values must absolute path.
